intro: Lipochaeta profusa, commonly known as the slender lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in coastal or inland regions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with distinctive bracts that give it its common name. Lipochaeta profusa is often found in open habitats and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
